page.description: Removes the records Remove_List from the Primary_table. Records are matched on the Primary_table_key
page.syntax: C table.remve_recs_in_list(C primary_table ,C remove_list ,C primary_table_key [,C transaction_table_key [,L silent ]])

argument.name: primary_table
argument.description: The name of the table that will have records removed from it.

argument.name: remove_list
argument.description: The name of the table containing the matching records to remove from the Primary_Table.

argument.name: primary_table_key
argument.description: The expression used to compute key values in the Primary_Table.

argument.name: transaction_table_key
argument.description: Optional. Default = Use the Primary_Key expression to compute key values. An expression (different from the Primary_Key expression ) to use to calculate the key values in the Remove_List table.

argument.name: silent
argument.description:
Optional.
.T. = Do not display a confirmation message before proceeding.
.F. = Display a confirmation message first.

page.discussion: The TABLE.REMVE_RECS_IN_LIST() method removes all of the records contained in the Remove_List table from the records in the Primary_Table. ( Note : Contrast this function with the <TBL>.SUBTRACT() operation which would create a new table with the Primary_Table records less the Remove_List records.) Alpha Anywhere determines which records from the Primary_Table to remove as follows. For each record in the Remove_List, Alpha Anywhere computes a key value, using the Transaction_Table_Key expression. If a corresponding key value (computed using the Primary_Key expression) is found, the record is removed.
